bibl.title: Despatch from Albert Bushnell to William M. Evarts, February 22, 1878
Despatches from United States Consuls in Gaboon, 1856-1888 T-466

text.body:
<div1 xml:lang="en" type="document"
<pb facs="20170615_143855"
I am happy to inform the Department that another interprise has been started for the purpose of establishing the grand discoveries, recently made by one countrys. Mr. U. Pearley on the Congo or Livingstons Maples from and Cravensteo bay Missionary gentlemen one route go the Congo, have passed a part of two days with me at this Agency. They have been is by philanthropies Merchants in Liverport + London; to o*unclear the south bank of the Congo to a point above the first rapids, where they are to establish an industrial Mister Mission These Ministers enterprises avail purpose the way for the attention of commerce of a navigation, upon those past interior *unclear* + of the development of the valuable natured *unclear* of Ethiopia.
Jremain Sir, Respectfully Your obident servant Albert Bushnell U.S. Com.A.
